Background: Originally a meek housewife, Carol overcomes domestic abuse to become a skilled, resourceful fighter capable of making difficult decisions.[30][31]
The group's primary hunter, Daryl becomes a key member of the group and Rick's trusted lieutenant.[28][29]

The first survivor Rick encounters in the first season. After suffering a psychological breakdown, he comes to peace with the world around him.[60][61],A lonesome pragmatic man, formerly a part of Rick Grimes' group on The Walking Dead, who encounters the core group of survivors and leads a pacifist agenda.[29]
The eldest daughter of the Greene family, Maggie marries Glenn, becomes pregnant with their child and becomes the leader of the Hilltop Colony.[32][33]
The series' former protagonist and a former sheriff's deputy, Rick is the leader of a group of survivors who becomes the leader of the Alexandria Safe Zone.[14][15]

A fierce, katana-wielding woman who joins Rick's group. Michonne eventually becomes Rick's romantic partner and a mother-figure to his son, Carl. She is also the mother-figure to Judith, daughter of Lori and Shane.[34][35]
The fiery yet compassionate daughter of Madison, and Nick's sister.[2][20]
A man who claims to know a cure for the walker virus, Eugene is cowardly and inefficient when dealing with walkers, but is very intelligent.[50][51]
A smart and sophisticated conman-turned-businessman, who forms friendships with the Clark family.[24]
Rick and Lori's young son. Carl is forced to mature and learn to survive in the deadly new post-apocalyptic world.[26][27]
A tough, focused, and very capable survivor, and also Abraham's girlfriend.[50][52]
A recruiter who invites Rick's group to Alexandria.[64][65]
A courageous and pragmatic former Sombra Negra member, a barber, Griselda's husband, and Ofelia's father.[2][23]
A priest who joins Rick's group. He lacks experience with walkers and struggles with his faith in the new world.[58][59]
A strong and cautious former member of the La Colonia community in Tijuana, Mexico, and Nick's girlfriend.[26]

A former pizza delivery boy who saved Rick's life. Glenn begins a relationship with Maggie Greene and later marries her. Over the course of the series, Glenn becomes an integral member of the group known for his character and resourcefulness.[24][25]

A ruthless and reluctant member of the Saviors who forms an intense rivalry with Daryl.[72][73],A ruthless and reluctant former lieutenant of the Saviors, who was exiled from Virginia by Rick's group on The Walking Dead and has travelled to Texas hoping to reunite with his ex-wife.[32]
An intelligent and domineering guidance counselor, the mother of Nick and Alicia, and Travis' fiancée.[2][20][18]
The totalitarian, sociopathic leader of the Saviors.[70][71]
Tyreese's fiery younger sister and a former firefighter, Sasha is the group's sharpshooter. After several personal losses, she suffers from PTSD.[45][46]
A former police academy student and lesbian. Tara joins Rick's group after having initially been affiliated with the Governor. She serves as a primary supply runner.[53][54][55]
The "king" of a community known as the Kingdom, Ezekiel is a former zookeeper with a pet Bengal tiger called Shiva.[78][79]
A member of the Kingdom and Ezekiel's steward.[96][97]
A kind and mysterious nurse encountered by Madison who has a history with John.[29]
A young girl who acts as a spy for the Vultures until she defects to Morgan's group.[30]
An isolated teenager in Alexandria who forms a close bond with Carl.[82][83]
A curious and tactical journalist who encounters Morgan and John.[29]
The adoptive sister of Wendell and a former U.S. Marine.[33][34]
Dwight's long-missing ex-wife who fled across the country to Texas after escaping the Saviors on The Walking Dead.[35]
A former military sergeant on a mission to bring Eugene to Washington, D.C. to find a cure for the walker virus.[49][50]
A former member of the Saviors who later switches his allegiance to the Hilltop.[86][87]
A soft-spoken teenage girl who enjoys singing, Beth is Hershel's younger daughter and Maggie's younger half-sister.[41][42]
A former worker at a nuclear power plant that began melting down who encounters Morgan's group.[31]
The selfish and treacherous leader of the Hilltop Colony.[76][77]
A veterinarian and farmer who maintains his faith and acts as the group's primary moral compass. Hershel is the father of Maggie and Beth Greene.[33][36]
A brave recovering heroin addict, Madison's son, and Alicia's brother.[2][3][20][21]
A scout and member of the Hilltop Colony.[74][75]
Rick's former police partner and best friend. In the second season, he forms an intense rivalry with Rick.[16][17]
A deaf member of Magna's group and Kelly's sister.[104][105]
The biological daughter of Lori and Shane who was adopted by Rick after she was born.[100][101]
Connie's alert and protective sister who has a gradual hearing loss.[111]
Alpha's daughter and former Whisperer.[102][103]
The feisty leader of a small group of roaming survivors and Yumiko's girlfriend.[98][99]
A resident of the Commonwealth who communicated with Eugene over the radio. She is also Mercer's younger sister.[110]
Magna's girlfriend who is a proficient archer and former criminal defense lawyer.[94][95]
A former civil rights attorney and member of the original Atlanta group of survivors.[20][21]
A lonely and friendly police officer whom Morgan encounters in Texas.[29]
Rick's wife, who has an affair with Shane when she believed Rick was dead.[18][19]
The racist and volatile older brother of Daryl Dixon. In the third season, he is the right-hand man to the Governor.[37][38]
The strong-willed and capable daughter of Daniel and his wife Griselda.[2][20]
The antagonistic leader of the town of Woodbury, the Governor is ruthless, paranoid, and dangerous.[39][40]
A former vagabond and doctor who is rescued by Carl and brought to Alexandria.[88][89]
A high-ranking member of the Saviors serving as Negan's right-hand man.[80][81]
Deanna's son and a guard of Alexandria.[66][67]
A resolute and peacekeeping high school teacher, Madison's fiancé, Chris' father, and Liza's ex-husband.[2][20]

Tough and compassionate, Tyreese places an emphasis on moral reasoning. He struggles to cope with the immoral nature of some of the group's survival tactics and finds it difficult to kill in defense of the group.[43][44]
A nihilistic painter who allies with Morgan's group.[34]
The impassive, enigmatic leader of the Scavengers.[84][85]
A quirky and flamboyant survivor who has suffered various traumas in her past and later joins Eugene's group.[106]
The leader of the Whisperers, a mysterious group of survivors who wear the skins of walkers to mask their presence.[90][91]
The second-in-command of the Whisperers and Alpha's right-hand man.[92][93]
A former army medic and recovering alcoholic who develops a close relationship with Sasha.[47][48]
Travis and Liza's rebellious teenage son, who becomes more brutal due to the landscape of the deadly new world.[2][22]
An older member of the group who owned the RV in which a group of survivors traveled. Often the voice of reason within the group.[22][23]
A former Congresswoman and original leader of Alexandria.[68][69]
A no-nonsense and caring nursing student, Travis' ex-wife, and Chris' mother.[2][20][22]
The cannibalistic leader of Terminus who captures and coerces Rick's group into submission before being executed by Rick.[56][57]
The racist and candid leader of Broke Jaw Ranch, and Jake and Troy's father.[28]
An Alexandria resident who develops a relationship with Rick.[62][63]
John's estranged father and a retired police officer.[36]
A member of the Reapers and former owner of Dog who formed a loving connection with Daryl while searching for Rick after his disappearance.[108]
The charismatic and impulsive son of Jeremiah, and Jake's half-brother.[27][28]
A resident of the Commonwealth who serves as the general of the Commonwealth military.[107]
The governor of the Commonwealth.[109]
A rebellious member of the Pioneers and Virginia's daughter.[34]
Jeremiah's moralistic and wiser son, Troy's half-brother, and Alicia's love interest.[28]
The deputy governor and director of operations to the Commonwealth.[109]
The empathetic leader of the Gonzalez Dam community, who is responsible for supplying water to the local population.[28]
A pragmatic and quiet survivor introduced in the Fear the Walking Dead: Flight 462 web series.[25]
